sourceMeaningMnemonic: In its <radical>soul</radical>, a <radical>narwhal</radical> that's supposed to do <radical>construction</radical> under the <radical>moon</radical>, will be too <kanji>lazy</kanji> to do it. And when your soul is lazy, there's no way you'll be able to get something done.
meaningInfo: Picture the lazy narwhal laying on a block of ice in the moonlight. There are tools and other blocks of ice around, but he just can't seem to get up and do any construction work.
readingMnemonic: You can't tell the <kanji>lazy</kanji> narwhal he's being lazy because he's your <reading>da</reading>d (<ja>だ</ja>). If he was anyone else you'd tell him off for being lazy, but you can't tell off your dad. That's just not right.
readingInfo: Picture your lazy dad. Your big, lazy narwhal dad.
